title: Urhobo (1977) Genesis Portion
description: Urhobo is a South-Western Edoid language spoken by the Urhobo people of southern Nigeria. From the region of Delta and Bayelsa State. They are also known as fishermen. Their neighbors are the Isoko to the South East, the Itsekiri to the West, Ijaw to the South, and Ukwuani people to the North East. Urhobo people are referred to as "Urhobians" or "Urhobeans"

language.name: Urhobo
language.area: Delta state, Ethiope and Ughelli LGAs.
